alert.note: Alert for Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHERN MEIGS...SOUTHEASTERN PERRY... WASHINGTON...NORTHERN JACKSON...MORGAN...VINTON...ATHENS AND NORTHWESTERN WOOD COUNTIES... At 201 PM EDT, a snow squall was located near Glouster, moving east at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Athens, Marietta, Belpre, Wellston, Nelsonville, Glouster, McConnelsville, Mcarthur, Beverly, Albany, Shawnee, Coolville, Chesterhill, Lake Hope State Park, Vienna, Williamstown, Washington, Lubeck and Boaz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 177 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 16. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 10. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this squall. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.
